contentrichtext.text: '''''[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=MediaWiki:VfD-Med&action=edit Add to this deletion debate]''''' *[[MediaWiki:Med]]. Not used. Has been blanked for three weeks, as discussed on the talk page. [[User:Angela|Angela]][[user talk:Angela|.]] 18:05, Mar 27, 2004 (UTC) **Delete -- [[User:Cyrius|Cyrius]] | [[User talk:Cyrius|Talk]] 20:21, Mar 27, 2004 (UTC) **Delete -- [[User:Maveric149|mav]] 20:45, 27 Mar 2004 (UTC) We have a disclaimer link now at the top and bottom of every page. **Delete for now. msg:med was originally created by me to replace existing text, and I accept that we already have a disclaimer (thanks [[User:Maveric149|mav]] et al.). However I would still like to see a more consistent and obvious approach on articles about medical conditions. The current various trends on these pages are to use one or more of: *** "… is … [[medical emergency]] …" [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Special:Whatlinkshere&target=Medical_emergency], e.g. [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]] *** [[call for help]] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=Special:Whatlinkshere&target=Call_for_help], e.g. [[aortic dissection]] *** "Wikipedia does not provide medical advice.", e.g. [[testicular torsion]] *** "… see a doctor …", "… see your doctor …", "… see a health care professional …", "… seek medical help …", "… seek medical assistance …", "… seek medical attention …", "… seek medical intervention …", e.g. [[sinusitis]] *** or to omit all of the above - e.g. [[suicide]] :::-- [[User:Zigger|Zigger]] 20:04, 2004 Mar 28 (UTC) *Delete. -- [[User:TakuyaMurata|Taku]] 05:36, Mar 29, 2004 (UTC)
